API ReferenceÔÉÅ

Core abstractions for discrete-time stochastic processes.

class stochlab.core.Path(times: ~numpy.ndarray, states: ~numpy.ndarray, extras: dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A single discrete-time sample path (X_0, X_1, ‚Ä¶, X_T).

Represents one realization of a stochastic process over discrete time steps.

timesÔÉÅ

Time points, typically [0, 1, 2, ‚Ä¶, T].

Type:

np.ndarray

statesÔÉÅ

State values at each time point (labels or indices).

Type:

np.ndarray

extrasÔÉÅ

Optional metadata (waiting times, payoffs, etc.).

Type:

dict[str, Any]

Examples

>>> times = np.array([0, 1, 2])
>>> states = np.array(["A", "B", "A"])
>>> path = Path(times=times, states=states)
>>> len(path)
3
>>> path[1]
'B'
extras: dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ
states: ndarrayÔÉÅ
times: ndarrayÔÉÅ
class stochlab.core.SimulationResult(paths: list[~stochlab.core.simulation.Path], metadata: dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Collection of sample paths with basic analysis methods.

Represents the output of a Monte Carlo simulation, containing multiple realizations of a stochastic process.

pathsÔÉÅ

Collection of sample paths from the simulation.

Type:

list[Path]

metadataÔÉÅ

Optional information about the simulation (process name, seed, etc.).

Type:

dict[str, Any]

Examples

>>> path1 = Path(times=np.array([0, 1]), states=np.array(["A", "B"]))
>>> path2 = Path(times=np.array([0, 1]), states=np.array(["A", "A"]))
>>> result = SimulationResult(paths=[path1, path2])
>>> len(result)
2
>>> df = result.to_dataframe()
>>> result.state_distribution(t=1)
{'A': 0.5, 'B': 0.5}
metadata: dict[str, Any]ÔÉÅ
paths: list[Path]ÔÉÅ
state_distribution(t: int) → dict[Hashable, float][source]ÔÉÅ

Empirical distribution of states at time index t across all paths.

Parameters:

t (int) ‚Äì Time index to analyze (0-based index into each Path).

Returns:

Mapping from state to empirical probability.

Return type:

dict[State, float]

to_dataframe() → DataFrame[source]ÔÉÅ

Convert simulation results to a pandas DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame with columns: - ‚Äòpath_id‚Äô : int (which simulated path) - ‚Äòt‚Äô : int (time index, 0-based) - ‚Äòtime‚Äô : Any (actual time value from Path.times) - ‚Äòstate‚Äô : State (state label or index)

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

class stochlab.core.StateSpace(states: Sequence[Hashable], _index_map: Mapping[Hashable, int] | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

Finite state space S = {s‚ÇÄ, s‚ÇÅ, ‚Ä¶, s‚Çô‚Çã‚ÇÅ} with bijective label ‚Üî index mapping.

Provides the foundation for all discrete-time stochastic processes by managing the finite set of possible states and their integer representations.

Parameters:

states (Sequence[State]) ‚Äì Ordered sequence of unique state labels (any hashable type).

statesÔÉÅ

The ordered state labels.

Type:

Sequence[State]

index_mapÔÉÅ

Read-only mapping from state label to integer index.

Type:

Mapping[State, int]

n_statesÔÉÅ

Number of states (alias for len(states)).

Type:

int

Examples

Basic usage:

>>> ss = StateSpace(["Bull", "Bear", "Sideways"])
>>> len(ss)
3
>>> ss.index("Bear")
1
>>> ss.state(0)
'Bull'
>>> "Bull" in ss
True

Complex state types:

>>> market_states = StateSpace([("Bull", "High"), ("Bull", "Low"), ("Bear", "High")])
>>> market_states.index(("Bear", "High"))
2

Mathematical ContextÔÉÅ

For a stochastic process (X‚Çú)‚Çú‚Çå‚ÇÄ·µÄ, this class defines: - State space: S = {s‚ÇÄ, s‚ÇÅ, ‚Ä¶, s‚Çô‚Çã‚ÇÅ} - Bijection: œÜ: S ‚Üí {0, 1, ‚Ä¶, n-1} - Used for transition matrix indexing: P[i,j] = P(X‚Çú‚Çä‚ÇÅ = s‚±º | X‚Çú = s·µ¢)

index(state: Hashable) → int[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the integer index corresponding to a state label.

Parameters:

state (State) ‚Äì The state label to look up.

Returns:

The index in [0, n_states-1].

Return type:

int

Raises:

KeyError ‚Äì If the state is not part of this StateSpace.

property index_map: Mapping[Hashable, int]ÔÉÅ

Mapping from state label -> integer index.

This is intended to be read-only. Do not mutate it.

property n_states: intÔÉÅ

Explicit property for the number of states (alias of len(ss)).

state(idx: int) → Hashable[source]ÔÉÅ

Return the state label corresponding to an integer index.

Parameters:

idx (int) ‚Äì Index in [0, n_states-1].

Returns:

The corresponding state label.

Return type:

State

Raises:

IndexError ‚Äì If idx is out of range.

states: Sequence[Hashable]ÔÉÅ
class stochlab.core.StochasticProcess[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for discrete-time stochastic processes on a finite state space.

Any concrete model (Markov chain, queue, branching process, etc.) must:

  • expose its finite state_space,

  • implement sample_path to generate a single Path.

This gives a uniform interface that other components (Monte Carlo, analytics, reporting) can rely on.

abstractmethod sample_path(T: int, x0: Hashable | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Path[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a single discrete-time sample path (X_0, ‚Ä¶, X_T).

Parameters:

  • T (int) ‚Äì Horizon (number of time steps minus one). The returned path will have length T+1, with times typically [0, 1, ‚Ä¶, T].

  • x0 (State, optional) ‚Äì Optional initial state. If None, the process may use a default initial distribution or a default starting state.

  • **kwargs (Any) ‚Äì Additional model-specific parameters for the simulation, if needed.

Returns:

The simulated path.

Return type:

Path

simulate_paths(n_paths: int, T: int, x0: Hashable | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → SimulationResult[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate multiple independent sample paths and wrap them in a SimulationResult.

This is a thin convenience wrapper around repeated calls to sample_path. More advanced Monte Carlo features (variance reduction, seeding strategies, parallelism, etc.) will live in a separate mc module.

Parameters:

  • n_paths (int) ‚Äì Number of independent paths to simulate. Must be >= 1.

  • T (int) ‚Äì Horizon for each path (see sample_path).

  • x0 (State, optional) ‚Äì Optional common initial state for all paths.

  • **kwargs (Any) ‚Äì Additional model-specific arguments forwarded to sample_path.

Returns:

Collection of simulated paths and basic metadata.

Return type:

SimulationResult

abstract property state_space: StateSpaceÔÉÅ

The finite state space on which this process evolves.

Returns:

The finite set of allowed states.

Return type:

StateSpace

Concrete stochastic process models.

class stochlab.models.MM1Queue(arrival_rate: float, service_rate: float, max_queue_length: int)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: StochasticProcess

Single-server queue with Poisson arrivals and exponential service times.

The state is the queue length (including any job in service) capped at max_queue_length, which provides the finite state space required by the core architecture. If the simulated queue would exceed this cap, a RuntimeError is raised, signalling that the user should increase the cap.

sample_path(T: int, x0: Hashable | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Path[source]ÔÉÅ

Simulate T event transitions of the embedded discrete-time chain.

Times in the returned Path correspond to event epochs and are spaced by exponential inter-arrival times with rate Œª + Œº ¬∑ ùüô{queue>0}.

property state_space: StateSpaceÔÉÅ

Finite state space {0, 1, ‚Ä¶, max_queue_length}.

class stochlab.models.MarkovChain(state_space: StateSpace, P: ndarray, initial_dist: ndarray | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: StochasticProcess

Finite-state, time-homogeneous Markov chain.

Parameters:

  • state_space (StateSpace) ‚Äì Finite set of states.

  • P (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Transition matrix of shape (n_states, n_states). P[i, j] = P(X_{t+1} = state_j | X_t = state_i).

  • initial_dist (np.ndarray | None) ‚Äì Optional initial distribution over states (length n_states). If None, a default (e.g. unit mass on first state) is used.

classmethod from_transition_matrix(states: Sequence[Hashable], P: ndarray, initial_dist: ndarray | None = None) → MarkovChain[source]ÔÉÅ

Build a MarkovChain directly from states and a transition matrix.

sample_path(T: int, x0: Hashable | None = None, **kwargs: Any) → Path[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a single sample path (X_0, ‚Ä¶, X_T) from the Markov chain.

property state_space: StateSpaceÔÉÅ

The finite state space for this Markov chain.

class stochlab.models.RandomWalk(lower_bound: int, upper_bound: int, p: float = 0.5)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: StochasticProcess

Simple random walk on integers [lower_bound, upper_bound] with reflecting boundaries.

At each step: move up with probability p, down with probability 1-p. At boundaries: must move back into interior.

sample_path(T: int, x0: int | None = None, **kwargs) → Path[source]ÔÉÅ

Generate a single discrete-time sample path (X_0, ‚Ä¶, X_T).

Parameters:

  • T (int) ‚Äì Horizon (number of time steps minus one). The returned path will have length T+1, with times typically [0, 1, ‚Ä¶, T].

  • x0 (State, optional) ‚Äì Optional initial state. If None, the process may use a default initial distribution or a default starting state.

  • **kwargs (Any) ‚Äì Additional model-specific parameters for the simulation, if needed.

Returns:

The simulated path.

Return type:

Path
